intro: Harrisia tortuosa, commonly known as the twisted harrisia, is a species of cactus native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems that often branch out. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or red in color. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom during the summer months. Harrisia tortuosa is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
